Config

You can change most settings in the config file.

Base

The base file gives most HTML elements sensible defaults.

Text

There's a couple of mixins you can use to turn anything into a heading (@include heading) or plain text (@include text).

Headings can also be set using the .h1 - .h6 classes.

Button

Use the button-class to create buttons. You can change the button color using --button-color.

Regular button Ghost button Different color

Section

This is a section. It's an element that is 100vw while its contents is var(--site-width)

Sections are useful for parts of the page that need a background color or image.

A section should only be used directly inside <main>. You should never nest sections or containers.

Container

A container is similar to a section except for two things:

  1. It doesn't span the entire width of the site
  2. It uses margin instead of padding

Containers are usefull for parts of the page that should be transparent.

Grid

Grids can easily be created using the grid class. To specify the number of columns you append --${num} to the class, like grid grid--2.

You can also combine the grid classes with the breakpoint classes to have a different number of columns in different resolutions, like this: grid tablet:grid--2 laptop:grid--3.

Icons

Icons are downloaded from fontello. Configure which icons you want to use in icons.json. Then use the icon-class anywhere you like:

Save Cancel

Like Continue

Auto Icons

Auto icons can be used on a wrapper containing links pointing to common resources like PDFs, images, Facebook, Twitter etc (you define the sources in config.scss).

Auto icons are only available as a mixin so you can use it like ul {@include auto-icons} on a list like this:

  • Facebook
  • Twitter

Aspect Ratio

You can use the ratio--classes to give an element a certain aspect ratio. Add more classes using the $ratios map in config.scss

Forms

There's some basic form styling in place for inputs, textareas and select elements.

There's also optional styling of HubSpot forms as well as Contact Form 7 forms available.

Radios

Checkboxes

Video

Use the video class around a video embed to make it 16/9 and responsive.

Video Embed

If you give an iframe embed a data-oembed attribute with a JSON containing at least a provider_name property you can use the VideoEmbed class to give it some special functionality.

You can also replace the src attribute with a data-src attribute to prevent loading the video until the play button is clicked.
